front.title: Diameter Attribute-Value Pairs for Cryptographic Key Transport

postal.street: Site B, Floor 12F, Huihong Mansion, No.91 Baixia Rd.

abstract.t: Some Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) applications require the transport of cryptographic keying material; this document specifies a set of Attribute-Value Pairs (AVPs) providing native Diameter support of cryptographic key delivery.

section.title: Introduction
section.t:
The Diameter EAP application defines the EAP-Master-Session-Key and EAP-Key-Name AVPs for the purpose of transporting cryptographic keying material derived during the execution of certain EAP methods (for example, EAP-TLS ). At most one instance of either of these AVPs is allowed in any Diameter message.
However, recent work has specified methods to derive other keys from the keying material created during EAP method execution that may require transport in addition to the MSK. In addition, ERP specifies new keys that may need to be transported between Diameter nodes.
This note specifies a set of AVPs allowing the transport of multiple cryptographic keys in a single Diameter message.

section.title: Standards Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

list.t: Domain-Specific Usage-Specific Root Key. This is a Usage-Specific Root Key derived from a DSRK .
reauthentication MSK . This is a per-authenticator key, derived from the rRK (see below).
reauthentication Root Key, derived from the EMSK or DSRK .

section.title: Attribute-Value Pair Definitions
section.t: This section defines new AVPs for the transport of cryptographic keys in the Diameter EAP application [RFC4072], as well as other Diameter applications.

section.title: Key AVP
section.t: The Key AVP (AVP Code <AC1>) is of type Grouped It contains the name, type and optionally, the usable lifetime of the key, as well as the keying material itself.

figure.artwork: Key ::= < AVP Header: AC1 > < Key-Type > { Keying-Material } [ Key-Lifetime ] [ Key-Name ] * [ AVP ]

section.title: Key-Type AVP
section.t:
The Key-Type AVP (AVP Code <AC2>) is of type Enumerated and signifies the type of the key being sent. The following values are defined in this document:
The EAP Master Session Key
A Domain-Specific Root Key .
A Usage Specific Root Key .
A reauthentication Root Key .
A reauthentication Master Session Key .
A Domain-Specific Usage-Specific Root Key .
If additional values are needed, they are to be assigned by IANA according to the policy stated in

section.title: Key-Name AVP
section.t: The Key-Name AVP is of type OctetString. It contains an opaque key identifier. Exactly how this name is generated and used depends on the key type and link layer in question, and is beyond the scope of this document (see and for discussions of key name generation in the context of EAP).

section.title: Keying-Material AVP
section.t: The Keying-Material AVP (AVP Code <AC3>) is of type OctetString. The exact usage of this keying material depends upon several factors, including the link layer in use and the type of the key; it is beyond the scope of this document.

section.title: Key-Lifetime AVP
section.t:
The Key-Lifetime AVP (AVP Code <AC4>) is of type Integer64 and represents the period of time (in seconds) for which the contents of the Keying-Material AVP is valid.
Applications using this value SHOULD consider the beginning of the lifetime to be the point in time when the keying material is first used.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The security considerations applicable to the Diameter Base Protocol are also applicable to this document, as are those in Section 8.4 of RFC 4072 .

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: Upon publication of this memo as an RFC, IANA is requested to assign values as described in the following sections.

section.title: AVP Codes
section.t:
Codes must be assigned for the following AVPs using the policy specified in RFC 3588, Section 11.1.1:

section.title: AVP Values
section.t: IANA is requested to create a new registry for values assigned to the Key-Type AVP and populated with the values defined in this document (. New values may be assigned for the Key-Type AVP using the "Expert Review" policy .
